column4: i tried to configure the driver for nvidia, and when i got to the terminal step, it said the script could not be automatically executed. what do i do?
it says "error: your x configuration has been altered".... any ideas?
your desktop isn't loading because of x server issues then right?
do dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg as root and if you don't know which driver to use try vesa, lspci should list your card then its only a matter of looking through repository for right driver
what?
if you don't feel like going through that then nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf and fix your settings up some
you may feel extremely stupid but when you were on your desktop before you could have went to restricted manager under system and instantly had nvidia driver working ;)
: i feel stupid because this is my first linux experience.
I had same problem yesterday I went overkill on setting up graphics driver then noticed it worked fine if I just checked that box on restricted drivers manager
: come again?
hmm.. that might be bad then try pulling up synaptic and make sure you have appropriate restricted-modules for your kernel
: what are the appropriate..... this is the first time i've done linux. ever. can you put it into idiot terms for me?
there is nvidia-glx, nvidia-glx-new, nvidia-glx-legacy you might want to figure out which package yours will need
also nvidia-settings package and some other one
your using a 32 bit operating system right? x86?
then uname -r command lists what kernel your using, get restricted modules with that label ok
you can search with synaptic or if your on command line try apt-cache search restricted-modules
then apt-get install package
install a 32 bit operating system on your computer and save your time, the 64 bit OS is only for servers and weird debugging database floating point jibbery stuff :/
64 bit os just allows extra machine code cheats that do nothing for average user
for some hardware it might be neccesary but that sort of hardware would never make it off the shelfs
